questiontext.text:
Exercise

In some questions below it will be necessary to apply integration by parts more than once.


Find

  1. \({\displaystyle\int \tan^{-1}(x)\,\mathrm{d}x}\),[[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]
  2. \({\displaystyle \int {@exp7@}\mathrm{d}x}\),[[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]] [[feedback:prt7]]
  3. \({\displaystyle \int {@exp8@}\mathrm{d}x}\).[[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]] [[feedback:prt8]]

Oppgave

I noen av oppgavene vil du måtte bruke delvis integrasjon flere ganger.


Regn ut

  1. \({\displaystyle\int \tan^{-1}(x)\,\mathrm{d}x}\),[[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]
  2. \({\displaystyle \int {@exp7@}\mathrm{d}x}\),[[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]] [[feedback:prt7]]
  3. \({\displaystyle \int {@exp8@}\mathrm{d}x}\).[[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]] [[feedback:prt8]]

generalfeedback.text:
We apply integration by parts: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\] or alternatively: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]


  1. Writing \(\displaystyle{\int \tan^{-1}x\mathrm{d}x =\int 1 \cdot \tan^{-1}x\mathrm{d}x}\) we have \(f(x)=\tan^{-1}\) and \(g(x)=1\).

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int \tan^{-1}(x) \mathrm{d}x &=\tan^{-1}(x) \int 1 \mathrm{d}x -\int \left( \dfrac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}\tan^{-1}(x)\right) \cdot\left(\int 1 \mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= x\tan^{-1}(x)- \int \dfrac{x}{1+x^2}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta6@}. \end{align}\)

  2. We are given the integral \({\displaystyle\int {@exp7@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    We have \( f(x) = {@f7@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g7@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp7@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f7@} \int {@g7@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df7@} \cdot \int {@g7@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f7* intg7@}- \int {@df7*intg7@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta7@}. \end{align}\)

  3. We are given the integral \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    We have \( f(x) = {@f8@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g8@}.\)

    Hence:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f8@} \int {@g8@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df8@} \cdot \int {@g8@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f8* intg8@}- \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x. \end{align}\)

    We need to find \(\displaystyle \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x\) using integration by parts again. We get:

    \(\displaystyle{ \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x = {@int(df8*intg8,x)@}}.\)

    Altogether we have:

    \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x = {@ta8@}}. \)

Vi bruker formelen for delvis integrasjon: \[ \int u{{\rm d}v\over {\rm d}x}{\rm d}x=uv- \int{{\rm d}u\over {\rm d}x}v\,{\rm d}x\] alternativt: \[\int f(x)g(x)\,{\rm d}x=f(x)\,\int g(x){\rm d}x -\int {{\rm d}f\over {\rm d}x}\left\{\int g(x){\rm d}x\right\}{\rm d}x.\]


  1. \(\displaystyle{\int \tan^{-1}x\mathrm{d}x =\int 1 \cdot \tan^{-1}x\mathrm{d}x}\), velger \(f(x)=\tan^{-1}\) og \(g(x)=1\).

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int \tan^{-1}(x) \mathrm{d}x &=\tan^{-1}(x) \int 1 \mathrm{d}x -\int \left( \dfrac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}x}\tan^{-1}(x)\right) \cdot\left(\int 1 \mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= x\tan^{-1}(x)- \int \dfrac{x}{1+x^2}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta6@}. \end{align}\)

  2. Gitt integralet \({\displaystyle\int {@exp7@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    Velg \( f(x) = {@f7@}\) og \(g(x) = {@g7@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp7@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f7@} \int {@g7@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df7@} \cdot \int {@g7@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f7* intg7@}- \int {@df7*intg7@}\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@ta7@}. \end{align}\)

  3. Gitt integralet \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x}.\)

    Vi velger \( f(x) = {@f8@}\) and \(g(x) = {@g8@}.\)

    Dermed:

    \(\begin{align} \int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x &={@f8@} \int {@g8@} \mathrm{d}x -\int \left({@df8@} \cdot \int {@g8@}\mathrm{d}x \right)\mathrm{d}x \\ &= {@f8* intg8@}- \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x. \end{align}\)

    Vi må finne \(\displaystyle \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x\) ved å bruke delvis integrasjon igjen. Vi får:

    \(\displaystyle{ \int {@df8*intg8@}\mathrm{d}x = {@int(df8*intg8,x)@}}.\)

    Tilsammen får vi:

    \(\displaystyle{\int {@exp8@} \mathrm{d}x = {@ta8@}}. \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
